This file is a merged representation of the entire codebase, combined into a single document by Repomix.

================================================================
File Summary
================================================================

Purpose:
--------
This file contains a packed representation of the entire repository's contents.
It is designed to be easily consumable by AI systems for analysis, code review,
or other automated processes.

File Format:
------------
The content is organized as follows:
1. This summary section
2. Repository information
3. Directory structure
4. Multiple file entries, each consisting of:
  a. A separator line (================)
  b. The file path (File: path/to/file)
  c. Another separator line
  d. The full contents of the file
  e. A blank line

Usage Guidelines:
-----------------
- This file should be treated as read-only. Any changes should be made to the
  original repository files, not this packed version.
- When processing this file, use the file path to distinguish
  between different files in the repository.
- Be aware that this file may contain sensitive information. Handle it with
  the same level of security as you would the original repository.

Notes:
------
- Some files may have been excluded based on .gitignore rules and Repomix's configuration
- Binary files are not included in this packed representation. Please refer to the Repository Structure section for a complete list of file paths, including binary files
- Files matching patterns in .gitignore are excluded
- Files matching default ignore patterns are excluded

Additional Info:
----------------

# To get started with Dependabot version updates, you'll need to specify which
# package ecosystems to update and where the package manifests are located.
# Please see the documentation for all configuration options:
# https://docs.github.com/github/administering-a-repository/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates

version: 2
updates:
  - package-ecosystem: "npm"
    directory: "/"
    schedule:
      interval: "monthly"
    allow:
      - dependency-type: "all"

File: .gitignore

# Logs
logs
*.log
npm-debug.log*
yarn-debug.log*
yarn-error.log*
lerna-debug.log*

# Diagnostic reports (https://nodejs.org/api/report.html)
report.[0-9]*.[0-9]*.[0-9]*.[0-9]*.json

# Runtime data
pids
*.pid
*.seed
*.pid.lock

# Directory for instrumented libs generated by jscoverage/JSCover
lib-cov

# Coverage directory used by tools like istanbul
coverage
*.lcov

# nyc test coverage
.nyc_output

# Grunt intermediate storage (https://gruntjs.com/creating-plugins#storing-task-files)
.grunt

# Bower dependency directory (https://bower.io/)
bower_components

# node-waf configuration
.lock-wscript

# Compiled binary addons (https://nodejs.org/api/addons.html)
build/Release

# Dependency directories
node_modules/
jspm_packages/

# TypeScript v1 declaration files
typings/

# TypeScript cache
*.tsbuildinfo

# Optional npm cache directory
.npm

# Optional eslint cache
.eslintcache

# Microbundle cache
.rpt2_cache/
.rts2_cache_cjs/
.rts2_cache_es/
.rts2_cache_umd/

# Optional REPL history
.node_repl_history

# Output of 'npm pack'
*.tgz

# Yarn Integrity file
.yarn-integrity

# dotenv environment variables file
.env
.env.test
.env.local
.env.copy

# parcel-bundler cache (https://parceljs.org/)
.cache

# Next.js build output
.next

# Nuxt.js build / generate output
.nuxt
dist

# Gatsby files
.cache/
# Comment in the public line in if your project uses Gatsby and *not* Next.js
# https://nextjs.org/blog/next-9-1#public-directory-support
# public

# vuepress build output
.vuepress/dist

# Serverless directories
.serverless/

# FuseBox cache
.fusebox/

# DynamoDB Local files
.dynamodb/

# TernJS port file
.tern-port

================
File: index.js
================
const express = require('express');
const path = require('path');
const session = require('express-session');
const pgSession = require('connect-pg-simple')(session);
const { Pool } = require('pg');
require('dotenv').config();
const crypto = require('crypto');
const bodyParser = require('body-parser');

const app = express();

app.use((req, res, next) => {
  if (req.headers.host === 'bank-statements.co') {
    return res.redirect(301, 'https://www.bank-statements.co' + req.url);
  }
  next();
});

// Load environment variables
if (process.env.NODE_ENV !== 'production') {
  require('dotenv').config();
}

const port = process.env.PORT || 3000;

// Configure PostgreSQL client
const pool = new Pool({
  connectionString: process.env.DATABASE_URL,
});

// Generate a random secret key
const generateSecretKey = () => {
  return crypto.randomBytes(32).toString('hex');
};

// Configure session middleware
app.use(session({
  store: new pgSession({
    pool: pool,
    tableName: 'session',
  }),
  secret: generateSecretKey(),
  resave: false,
  saveUninitialized: false,
  cookie: {
    //secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production',
    maxAge: 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000, // 24 hours in milliseconds
    //httpOnly: true,
    //sameSite: 'strict',
  },
}));

const cors = require('cors');
app.use(cors());

// Configure body-parser with error handling
app.use((req, res, next) => {
  bodyParser.json({
    verify: (req, res, buf) => {
      req.rawBody = buf.toString();
    }
  })(req, res, (err) => {
    if (err) {
      console.error('Body parsing error:', err);
      res.status(400).json({ error: 'Invalid JSON' });
    } else {
      next();
    }
  });
});

app.use(bodyParser.urlencoded({ extended: true, limit: '50mb' }));

app.use(express.json());
app.use(express.urlencoded({ extended: true }));
app.use(express.static(path.join(__dirname, 'public')));

app.set('view engine', 'ejs');
app.set('views', path.join(__dirname, 'views'));

app.post('/api/getBearerToken', async (req, res) => {
  const { userId } = req.body;

  try {
    const result = await pool.query('SELECT token FROM tokens WHERE user_id = $1 LIMIT 1', [userId]);

    if (result.rows.length > 0) {
      const token = result.rows[0].token;
      res.json({ token });
    } else {
      res.status(404).json({ error: 'Bearer token not found' });
    }
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error retrieving bearer token:', error);
    res.status(500).json({ error: 'Internal server error' });
  }
});

// Custom error handling middleware for body-parser errors
app.use((err, req, res, next) => {
  if (err instanceof SyntaxError && err.status === 400 && 'body' in err) {
    console.error('Bad JSON', err);
    return res.status(400).send({ status: 400, message: 'Bad request' });
  }
  next();
});

// Increase the limit of the request body size
app.use(express.json({ limit: '10mb' }));
app.use(express.urlencoded({ extended: true, limit: '10mb' }));

app.post('/login', async (req, res) => {
  const { userId, userEmail } = req.body;

  try {
    // Store user details in the session
    req.session.user = {
      id: userId,
      email: userEmail,
    };

    // Save the session
    await req.session.save((err) => {
      if (err) {
        console.error('Error saving session:', err);
        res.status(500).send('Internal Server Error');
      } else {
        res.sendStatus(200);
      }
    });
    
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error during login:', error);
    res.status(500).send('Internal Server Error');
  }
});

app.post('/logout', (req, res) => {
  try {
    // Destroy the session
    req.session.destroy((err) => {
      if (err) {
        console.error('Error destroying session:', err);
        res.status(500).send('Internal Server Error');
      } else {
        res.sendStatus(200);
      }
    });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error during logout:', error);
    res.status(500).send('Internal Server Error');
  }
});

app.get('/', async (req, res) => {
  try {
    let isAuthenticated = false;
    let userEmail = '';
    let userId = '';
    let creditBalance = 0;

    if (req.session.user) {
      isAuthenticated = true;
      userId = req.session.user.id;
      userEmail = req.session.user.email;

      // Update the query to only count non-expired credits
      const creditResult = await pool.query(
        'SELECT SUM(credit_balance) AS total_credits FROM creditbalances WHERE user_id = $1 AND expiry_date >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP',
        [userId]
      );
      creditBalance = creditResult.rows[0].total_credits || 0;
    }

    res.render('index', {
      url: req.protocol + '://' + req.get('host') + req.originalUrl,
      isAuthenticated: isAuthenticated,
      creditBalance: creditBalance,
      userEmail: userEmail,
      userId: userId,
      stripeStarterLink: process.env.STRIPE_STARTER_LINK,
      stripeProLink: process.env.STRIPE_PRO_LINK,
      stripeEnterpriseLink: process.env.STRIPE_ENTERPRISE_LINK,
      clerkPublishableKey: process.env.CLERK_PUBLISHABLE_KEY // Add this line
    });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error rendering index page:', error);
    res.status(500).send('Internal Server Error');
  }
});

app.get('/privacy-policy', async (req, res) => {
  try {
    let isAuthenticated = false;
    let creditBalance = 0;

    if (req.session.user) {
      isAuthenticated = true;
      const userId = req.session.user.id;

      // Retrieve the credit balance for the authenticated user
      const creditResult = await pool.query('SELECT SUM(credit_balance) AS total_credits FROM creditbalances WHERE user_id = $1 AND expiry_date >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP', [userId]);
      creditBalance = creditResult.rows[0].total_credits || 0;
    }

    res.render('privacy-policy', {
      url: req.protocol + '://' + req.get('host') + req.originalUrl,
      isAuthenticated: isAuthenticated,
      creditBalance: creditBalance
    });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error rendering privacy policy page:', error);
    res.status(500).send('Internal Server Error');
  }
});

app.get('/terms-of-service', async (req, res) => {
  try {
    let isAuthenticated = false;
    let creditBalance = 0;

    if (req.session.user) {
      isAuthenticated = true;
      const userId = req.session.user.id;

      // Retrieve the credit balance for the authenticated user
      const creditResult = await pool.query('SELECT SUM(credit_balance) AS total_credits FROM creditbalances WHERE user_id = $1 AND expiry_date >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP', [userId]);
      creditBalance = creditResult.rows[0].total_credits || 0;
    }

    res.render('terms-of-service', {
      url: req.protocol + '://' + req.get('host') + req.originalUrl,
      isAuthenticated: isAuthenticated,
      creditBalance: creditBalance
    });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error rendering terms of service page:', error);
    res.status(500).send('Internal Server Error');
  }
});

app.get('/api/creditBalance', async (req, res) => {
  if (req.session.user) {
    const userId = req.session.user.id;
    console.log('Fetching credit balance for user:', userId);
    try {
      // Update the query to only count non-expired credits
      const creditResult = await pool.query(
        'SELECT SUM(credit_balance) AS total_credits FROM creditbalances WHERE user_id = $1 AND expiry_date >= CURRENT_TIMESTAMP',
        [userId]
      );
      const totalCredits = creditResult.rows[0].total_credits || 0;
      console.log('Credit balance query result:', creditResult.rows[0]);
      console.log('Total credits for user:', totalCredits);
      
      // Also log the raw credit records for debugging
      const creditRecords = await pool.query(
        'SELECT id, user_id, credit_balance, purchase_date, expiry_date FROM creditbalances WHERE user_id = $1',
        [userId]
      );
      console.log('Credit records found:', creditRecords.rows.length);
      console.log('Credit records:', creditRecords.rows);
      
      res.json({ totalCredits, isAuthenticated: true });
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error retrieving credit balance:', error);
      res.status(500).json({ error: 'Internal server error' });
    }
  } else {
    console.log('No user in session, returning 0 credits');
    res.json({ totalCredits: 0, isAuthenticated: false });
  }
});

// Add this route to serve the Stripe Billing Portal URL to the client
app.get('/api/stripe-billing-url', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ url: process.env.STRIPE_BILLING_PORTAL_URL });
});

app.get('/pricing', async (req, res) => {
  try {
    let isAuthenticated = false;
    let userEmail = '';
    let userId = '';

    if (req.session.user) {
      isAuthenticated = true;
      userId = req.session.user.id;
      userEmail = req.session.user.email;
    }

    res.render('pricing', {
      isAuthenticated: isAuthenticated,
      userEmail: userEmail,
      userId: userId,
      stripeStarterLink: process.env.STRIPE_STARTER_LINK,
      stripeProLink: process.env.STRIPE_PRO_LINK,
      stripeEnterpriseLink: process.env.STRIPE_ENTERPRISE_LINK
    });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Error rendering pricing page:', error);
    res.status(500).send('Internal Server Error');
  }
});

// Add this route to serve the FASTAPI_BASE_URL to the client
app.get('/api/fastapi-url', (req, res) => {
  res.json({ url: process.env.FASTAPI_BASE_URL });
});

// Add this error handling middleware at the end
app.use((err, req, res, next) => {
  console.error('Unhandled error:', err);
  res.status(500).json({ error: 'Internal Server Error' });
});

app.listen(port, () => {
  console.log(`Server is running on http://localhost:${port}`);
});

File: package.json
